Caption: 

### ğŸ“ What you need to know

Bitcoin fell to its [lowest price in weeks](https://decrypt.co/333158/bitcoin-ethereum-sink-tariff-gloom-rate-optimism) early Friday following another round of tariff hits from President Trump against trading partners, along with a rough jobs report that included sharp revisions to previous monthsâ€™ data.

Altcoins are down worse than Bitcoin, with Ethereum and Solana falling 5% compared to a 3% dip for BTC, while stock indices are showing red on the day. And Coinbase stock has taken a dive, down 15% today following [Thursdayâ€™s earnings miss](https://decrypt.co/333038/coinbase-stock-dives-company-q2-revenue-forecasts).

Bitcoin is now nearly 7% away from its all-time high mark hit in July, with CryptoQuant analysts expecting the correction to [potentially last months](https://decrypt.co/333081/bitcoin-correction-more-downside-likely-cryptoquant) as whales and miners cash out profits. But one analyst told _Decrypt_ that rising optimism for a rate cut at the next Fed meeting could fuel further gains.

â€œNow that rate cuts are back on the table for the next Fed meeting, liquidity conditions may open up againâ€”a powerful tailwind for risk assets like crypto,â€ said 21Shares Research Analyst Matt Mena. â€œIf a Fed cut becomes all but guaranteed, Bitcoin could quickly propel toward $125K.â€

Bitcoin, Ethereum Sink as Tariff Gloom Tops Rate Cut Optimism: (https://decrypt.co/333158/bitcoin-ethereum-sink-tariff-gloom-rate-optimism)

Bitcoin Correction Could Linger for Months: CryptoQuant: (https://decrypt.co/333081/bitcoin-correction-more-downside-likely-cryptoquant)
